intro: Graffenrieda laurina, commonly known as the evergreen flame flower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its evergreen foliage and striking, tubular red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. Graffenrieda laurina thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for tropical gardens and indoor cultivation.
